lg.l: vyavahārān didr̥kṣus tu brāhmaṇaiḥ saha pārthivaḥ
mantrajñair mantribhiś caiva vinītaḥ praviśet sabhām ||

div.p: kunaṅ hulaha saṅ prabhu, uniṅānira taṅ vyavahāranikaṅ rāt, harovaṅa ta sira brāhmaṇa vihikan maṅaji, lavan mantri vruhmantri riṁ vruḥmantri, vruḥ mavivekāmavikvekā, sulakṣaṇaha ta sira tumamaha riṅ sabhā.

lg.l: tatrāsīnaḥ sthito vāpi pāṇim udyamya dakṣiṇam |
vinītaveṣābharaṇaḥ paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||

div.p: haliṅgihāpagəhahaliṅgih apagəhahaliṅgiḥ pagəha: ta sira riṅ sabhā, taṅanira tṅən hatah ulahakniraula:knira, hayvātuduh-tuduhhayva tuduḥtuduḥ* kiva, bhūṣaṇa-pahyasniṅ vvaṅ suśīlātah lviranira, iṅət-iṅətənirātah yogyāyogyani kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

lg.l: pratyahaṁ deśadr̥ṣṭaiś ca śāstradr̥ṣṭaiś ca hetubhiḥ |
aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu nibaddhāni pr̥thak pr̥thak ||

div.p:
*sari masiha sirān ṅiṅət-iṅəta makasādhanaṅmakasa:danaṁmakasḍanaṁ vara-varah saṅ hyaṅ āgama mānavādimanava:vī, mvaṅ sakinapagəhaknikaṅ sapañjiṅ deśanya, deśa ṅaranya, sadaṅayan, sajamus vuṅkal, savuravan, sakanuruhan, an hana *kaparǝkanya deniṅ āgama, ya hika deśadr̥ṣṭa ṅaranya,
aṅkǝnhankan deśa sasiki svadeśanikaṅ vyavahāra, aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣuAṣṭadaṣasu marggehaṣṭa:deṣa:su ma:rgge, irikā sthānaniṅ vyavahāra vvaluvalu vlas kvehnya, salviraniṅ vicāraniṅsalviriṅ vyavahāra, hana tinmunya ṅkāna salah siki, paḍa madudva-dudvanpadudvadudvan viṣayanya.

lg.l: hiṁsāṁ yaḥ kurute kaś cid deyaṁ vā na prayacchati |
sthāne te dve vivādasya bhinno ’ṣṭādaśadhā punaḥ ||

list.item: This stanza is absent from Olivelle's constituted text, though it is referenced in his app. crit. for one manuscript. The stanza occurs in ed. Mandlik 8.4 with reading bhinno, where the Svayambhu implies bhinne.

div.p: hiṁsāṁ yaḥIṅsīyaIṅsa:ya kurute kaś cit, hana vvaṅ mamātyani nirdoṣa, maṅlarani nirdoṣa, kunaṅ deyam vāva na prayacchatiprayaścati, tan paveh irikaṅ yogya vehaknavehikna, aveh irikaṅ tan yogya vehaknanya kunaṅ, sthānesvane te dve vivādasya, ya ikāhikaṁ sthānaniṅ vyavahāra, rvaṅ siki mūlanyamalanya, bhinnebhine ’ṣṭādaśadhāṣṭedaśada:ṣṭedaśada punaḥ, matmahan ta ya vvalu vlas vkasan.

lg.l: teṣām ādyam r̥ṇādānaṁ nikṣepo ’svāmivikrayaḥ |
saṁbhūya ca samutthānaṁ dattasyānapakarma ca ||
vetanasyaiva cādānaṁ saṁvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ |
krayavikrayānuśayo vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ ||
sīmāvivādadharmaś ca pāruṣye daṇḍavācike |
steyaṁ ca sāhasaṁ caiva strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva ca ||
strīpuṁdharmo vibhāgaś ca dyūtam āhvānaāhvaya eva ca |
padāny aṣṭādaśaitāni vyavahārasthitāv iha ||

div.p:
lvirnya: teṣām ādyam r̥ṇādānamtapīm adyam r̥ṣada:nītepaṃm adyam r̥sadanaṃ, tan kasahuraniṅ hutaṅkasahurapihutaṁkasahurapyutaṁOur conjecture is inspired by a passage in the Tantri Kāmandaka, p. 30: maṅkana kagavayaniṅ yajñadharma, mvaṅ kasahuraniṅ utaṅ., hādiniṅ vyavahāra. nikṣepa, tan kavehaniṅ patuvava. asvāmivikrayavikriya, hadval tan dr̥vya.
sambhūya ca samutthānamsa:mbhūyasya samūrtthaniṁsambuyasya samūtthanaṃBoth mss. point to sambhūyasya, analogous to dattasya but ungrammatical., tan kaduman ulihiṅ kinabehan. dattasyānapakarmadattasyanasaka:rmmadattasyana: karma ca, *karuddhāniṅkaradḍaniṁ huvus vinehakən.

vetanasyaiva cādānamvetanasya na ca daniṁveka:nasya na cadanaṃ, tan kavehaniṅ upahan. samvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ, advā riṁ samaya. krayavikrayānuśayokrayanūṣa:yoḥkraya:nuṣa:yoḥ, alarāmbəknyān pamlinya kunaṅ. vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥviva:dḍaḥ sva:miphalayaḥviva:dḍaḥ svamiphalayaḥ, vivādaniṅvivana:daniṁ *pinaṅvanakən mvaṅ maṅvan. sīmāvivādadharmaśsīma:viva:dḍa:ḍarmma:śsima:viva:ḍḍadarmmaś ca, kahucapaniṅ vatəs. pāruṣye daṇḍavācike, sāhasaniṅ ḍaṇḍaḍaṇḍaniṅ sa:ha:rṣaḍaṇḍaniṁ saha:rṣaWe speculate that the intrusive layar might have its original in a scribal mark that would have been used in an ancestor manuscript to indicate that the order ḍaṇḍa/sāhasa is to be inverted to get a suitable paraphrase for daṇḍapāruṣya.
, vākpāruṣya.
steyamstheyamsveyam, pavr̥ttiniṅ maliṅ. sāhasam, ulah sāhasa. strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva casaṅgrahaname Uva:cca:saṅgrahaname Uva:cca, ulah tan yogya riṅ lakī strī.strīpuṁdharmo, the next ground of litigation in Manu’s list, is omitted after this. Is it understood to be implied in the item [strī]saṁgrahaṇam? Or are we dealing with an omission in our two witnesses that does not reflect the original state of our text? vibhāgaśvinagaś ca, kadumaniṅ dr̥vya. dyūtamdyuta, totohan tan prāṇi. āhvānamAhvanam·The vulgate reading of MānDhŚ is āhvaya here, but several mss. used by Olivelle2005_01 share the reading with n that seems to have been received on Bali., totohan prāṇi. padāny aṣṭādaśaitānipada AṣṭadaśetaniAṣṭadasetani, nahan ta vvaluva:luvalu vlas lvirnya. vyavahārasthitānīhavyava:hara:sthita:nihavyavahara:stitanihaThe vulgate reading of MānDhŚ is vyavahārasthitāv iha here, but it seems that the text received on Bali had the (unmetrical) reading that we adopt here. Olivelle’s ms. Be1 has the variant -sthitāni ca., byakta pinakasthānaniṅpinaka:stana: vyavahāra.

lg.l: eṣu sthāneṣu bhūyiṣṭhaṁ vivādaṁ caratāṁ nr̥ṇām |
dharmaṁ śāśvatam āśritya kuryāt kāryavinirṇayam ||

div.p: eṣu sthāneṣu bhūyiṣṭhamEvustha:neṣṭabhuya:ṣṭiṁUvustha:neṣṭabhūyaśṭaṃ, ikaṅ vyavahārasthāna vvaluva:luvalu vlas, kapva hana katmunyata tmunya ṅkana, kapagəhakna saṅ prabhu, yuktinikaṅ vyavahāranya, apan gavayaknanira pagəh i kāryanikaṅnikā yogya pagəhaknanira.

lg.l: yadā svayaṁ na kuryāt tu nr̥patiḥ kāryadarśanam |
tadā niyuñjyād vidvāṁsaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ kāryadarśane ||

div.p: kunaṅ saṅ prabhu hayva sira gumavayakən ikaṅ kāryāmivakṣa guṇadoṣa, hakona ta sira ririṁ saṅ brāhmaṇaprabrahmaṇna vihikan maṅajiaṅaji, kumavruhana yogyanikaṅ vvaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

lg.l: aṣṭādaśapadābhijñaṁ prāḍvivāketi saṁjñitam |
ānvīkṣikyāṁ ca kuśalaṁ śrutismr̥tiparāyaṇam ||

list.item: This stanza is absent from Olivelle's constituted text, though it is referenced in his app. crit. for ms. Ox2 after 8.9. Mandlik (p. 877) and Jha include the stanza at the beginning of Medhātithi’s comment on 8.9; in his notes, Jha (v. 9, p. 490) cites citations of this verse in medieval scholastic works. In contrast with the cases in Div. XX and YY, van Naerssen (1956) did not notice that the Old Javanese text here implies the presence of this stanza because the Sanskrit original is not quoted.

div.p: saṅ brāhmaṇa saṅ vruh riṅ aṣṭādaśavyavahāra, sira ta saṅ sinaṅguh prāgvivākaThe word is consistently spelled pragvivakā in both manuscipts., saṅ vruh riṅ aji tarkatanka vruha riṅ śruti veda. kunaṅ ikaṅ tantraniṅ vicāra, gavayakna rumuhun, sādhana saṅ prāgvivāka matakvanpatakvan irikaṅikaṁ mavyavahāra kalih, vivekanira ta sahurnya vkasan, mataṅhyan prāgvivāka pva ṅaranira.

lg.l: so ’sya kāryāṇi saṁpaśyet sabhyair eva tribhir vr̥taḥ |
sabhām eva praviśyāgryām āsīnaḥ sthita eva vā ||

div.p: haṅiṅət-iṅəta tahaṅiṅətiṅəttha saṅ prāgvivāka, hi kāryanikaṅhinaryyanikaṁ mavyavahāra kalih, harovaṅa ta sira vvaṅ yogya riṅ sabhāsana: tigaṅ viji, tumamahajumamaha: ta sirāluṅguhāpagəhasira:luṅguḥhapagəhasiraluṅguḥhapagəhaIt would also be possible to interpet the manuscript evidence as supporting sirāluṅguh apagəha, with irrealis suffix only on the second form. riṅ sabhā.

lg.l: yasmin deśe niṣīdanti viprā vedavidas trayaḥ |
rājñaś ca prakr̥to vidvān brahmaṇas tāṁ sabhāṁ viduḥ ||

div.p: saṅ brāhmaṇa tigaṅ siki, paḍa vruh maṅaji, hana brāhmaṇa sasiki prajñān vidagdha, vinidhi muṅgva riṅ deśa saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ deśa papupulanira, yeka deśa sabhā ṅaranya de saṅ paṇḍitayeka de saṁ paṇḍita .

lg.l: na sā sabhā yatra na santi vr̥ddhā
vr̥ddhā na te ye na vadanti dharmam |
nāsau dharmo yatra na satyam asti
na tat satyaṁ yac chalenānuviddham ||

list.item: dharmo viddhas tv adharmeṇa sabhāṁ yatropatiṣṭhate | śalyaṁ cāsya na kr̥ntanti viddhās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||

div.p:
ikaṅ sabhāśana:, yan tan ana saṅ vr̥ddhah tan sabhā ṅaranya, saṅ vr̥ddhah yan tan vruh iṅriṅ dharma, tan vr̥ddhaḥ ṅaranira, saṅ vruh iṅriṅ dharma yan tan agəgvanaBoth mss. present an irrealis here. Emend agəgvan? kajātyan, tan dharma ṅaranikā, kunaṅ yan tan ginavayakəngina§
va:yan ikaṅ dharma riṅ sabhā, sukət paṅəməh ṅaranikā sahaneṅsaṁ haneṁ sabhā, mapanmavan ikaṅ deśa kinahananiṅ dharma, tan kavoraniṅkavoranaṅ adharmi, yeka sabhā ṅaranya.

lg.l: sabhā vā na praveṣṭavyā vaktavyaṁ vā samañjasam |
abruvan vibruvan vāpi naro bhavati kilbiṣī ||

div.p: kunaṅ hikaṅ vvaṅ haṅujarakən prāya yukti, salah denya vkasan, makveh ujarnya, vvaṅ katon doṣanyaḍeṣanya, ika ta kabeh tan yogya tumamaha riṅ sabhā.

lg.l: yatra dharmo hy adharmeṇa satyaṁ yatrānr̥tena ca |
hanyate prekṣamāṇānāṁ hatās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||

div.p: mataṅyan maṅkana, dharmanika saṅ uniṅa riṅ dharma, hilaṅ ikā deniṅ adharma riṅ sabhā, kasatyanirakasaktyanira maṅkanātah hilaṅnikā deniṅ adva riṅ sabhā, yapvan alah juga dharma deniṅ adharma, halah juga satya deniṅ adva, paḍa hana pva ya riṅ sabhā, patimbunaniṅpatambunaniṁ kunapa ṅaraniṅ sabhā yan maṅkana.

lg.l: dharma eva hato hanti dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ |
tasmād dharmo na hantavyo mā no dharmo hato ’vadhīt ||

div.p: kunaṅ yan iṅilaṅakən saṅ hyaṅ dharma, malǝs juga sira maṅilaṅakən, yan rinakṣa saṅ hyaṅ dharma malǝs juga sira maṅrakṣamarakṣa, mataṅyanmataṅhyan·mataṅhya maṅkana, hayvāṅilaṅakən dharma, liṅniṅ vvaṅ, tan paṅilaṅakən pva kita dharma, tan paṅilaṅakən sira hiri ya, maṅkanamaṅka liṅ atǝhər pramāṇastavapraṇama:stavapraṇama:stava.

hapanlapan tan ana lǝviha sakeṅ dharma, sira pinakapramāṇan riṅThe reading is supported by both witnesses. Emend pinakakapramāṇan riṅ, pinakapramāṇa riṅ or pinakapramāṇaniṅ? loka, sira ta pinakasvarga saṅ magavesamagave hayu, sira pinakakalǝpasan saṅ paṇḍita, tan maṅkana hikaṅ vvaṅ adharma, tan ana gumantyanagamantyanya maṅkanāta saṅka pisana tuvi.
mapan ikaṅ loka kabeh, dharma humagəhakən ika, kinapagəhakən pva sira de saṅ yatna, malǝsira magəhakən, apan tan pāpa hikaṅ loka maṅkana, ikaṅ tan aṅilaṅakən dharma.

lg.l: vr̥ṣo hi bhagavān dharmas tasya yaḥ kurute tv alam |
vr̥ṣalaṁ taṁ vidur devās tasmād dharmaṁ na lopayet ||

div.p: mataṅnyanmataṅhyan maṅkana, lǝmbu rūpa bhaṭārabha:va:ra dharma, hana ta vvaṅvvavvata vaṁ tan agave dharma, yeka pāpa liṅniṅ deva, maṅkana pva ya, hayva kita maṅilaṅakən dharma.

lg.l: eka eva suhr̥d dharmo nidhāne ’py anuyāti yaḥ |
śarīreṇa samaṁ nāśaṁ sarvam anyad dhi gacchati ||

div.p: saṅsa tumut ri kālaniṅ pati sira ta bhaṭāra dharma, mitra tan pakarva pva, parǝṅ ilaṅ mvaṅ śarīra, mvaṅ dharma, kunaṅ hikaṅ dr̥vya len sakerika, salah paran ika.

lg.l: pādo ’dharmasya kartāraṁ pādaḥ sākṣiṇam r̥cchati |
pādaḥ sabhāsadaḥ sarvān pādo rājānam r̥cchati ||

div.p: saṅ hyaṅ dharma saparǝpatansaparapatansaparaṭa:pantan tinǝmuniṅ mavyavahāra yan satya, maṅkana hikaṅ sākṣi yan satya, hanmu saparǝpatanirasaparaparatanirasaṁ parapata sira: saṅ hyaṅsaṁṅyaṁ dharma, maṅkana saṅ mavivakṣa kabeh, yan satya hanǝmu saparǝpatanirasaparapatanira saṅ hyaṅ dharmātah, saṅ prabhu hanǝmu saparǝpatanirātahsaparapatanirata:ḥsaparapatanira:taḥ, hagəṅ juga phalaniṅ kasatyanka:satyaniṁ ginavayakən.

lg.l: rājā bhavaty anenās tu mucyante ca sabhāsadaḥ |
eno gacchati kartāraṁ nindārho yatra nindyate ||

div.p:
saṅ prabhu tan kahanan sira riṅri pāpa, saṅ mavivakṣa kabeh luput sira riṅ pāpa, ikaṅ mavyavahāra salah pakṣanya juga təmpuhanya, nininda siṅsi saṅkananya, kahava tkeṅkahavat·
tkeṁ deśa kahananya.

lg.l: jātimātropajīvī vā kāmaṁ syād brāhmaṇabruvaḥ |
dharmapravaktā nr̥pater na tu śūdraḥ kathaṁ cana ||
yasya śūdras tu kurute rājño dharmavivecanam |
tasya sīdati tad rāṣṭraṁ paṅke gaur iva paśyataḥ ||

div.p: maṅkana saṅ prabhu, yan śūdra prāgvivākanira, kaḍatvanira durbalaḍūrbbala:ḍūrgghala kṣaya, kadi lǝmbu kaptək riṅ latək ajro.

list.item: Bhīṣmaparva 124.19: kadi lǝmbu kapǝtǝk iṅ latǝk

lg.l: yad rāṣṭraṁ śūdrabhūyiṣṭhaṁ nāstikākrāntam advijam |
vinaśyaty āśu tat kr̥tsnaṁ durbhikṣavyādhipīḍitam ||

div.p: ikaṅ rājya, yan kakehaniṅiṁ kakehaniṁ śūdra, hakveh vvaṅhakeḥ vaṁ manayākən deva hiriya, tan pabrāhmaṇa, ikaṅ rājya maṅkana, śīghra hilaṅ deniṅ lapā vyādhi bhaya kaḍatvanira.

list.item: vyavahārān svayaṁ paśyet sabhyaiḥ parivr̥to ’nvaham || YDh 1.360 = BṛhSm 1.1.106]

div.p: maṅkana pva ya, maṅutusa ta sirāmivakṣaha, vvaṅ vruh iṅ āgama, śīghra maṅucapa yan tinakvanan, saṅ makveh kavruhnirakavruḥnya śruti veda, paḍaməlakna vataṅan pāt, ikaṅ vet an pamivakṣana*, sakveh saṅ humuṅguhhikaṁ muṅguḥ irika, sira tahirika ta sira paḍa umiṅət-iṅəta sarasaniṅ vyavahāra.

lg.l: dharmāsanam adhiṣṭhāya saṁvītāṅgaḥ samāhitaḥ |
praṇamya lokapālebhyaḥ kāryadarśanam ārabhet ||

div.p: maṅkanānaknamaṅkanaknamaṅkana:kna sajiniṅ vataṅan, apuy riṅ payajñanvayajña:n·, kumbha mesya bañu, halalaṅ, sarvavīja, maṇik curiga muṅgva riṅ səṇḍi. tumama pva saṅ prāgvivāka riṅ sabhā, mavḍihana, asalimputamavḍihana, saliputamavḍihana:, salimputa, maṅañjaliha riṅ caturlokapāla, lumkasa ta sira maṅiṅət-iṅəta kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

lg.l: arthānarthāv ubhau buddhvā dharmādharmau ca kevalau |
varṇakrameṇa sarvāṇi paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||

div.p:
kavruhananira kaṅ ujar adon lavan tan padon, mvaṅ ikaṅmvahaṁ§
kaṁ tuhu lavan adva, nahan ta kāryanikaṅ vyavahāra kalih, iniṅət-iṅətǝnira, tumutana kramaniṅ varṇanikaṅ vyavahāra.

lg.l: bāhyair vibhāvayel liṅgair bhāvam antargataṁ nr̥ṇām |
svaravarṇeṅgitākāraiś cakṣuṣā ceṣṭitena ca ||

div.p: adharmahaḍarmma:da:rmma:buddhinikaṅ vyavahāra, iṅətakənanyaIṅətakənya tuvi, kavruhana de saṅ prāgvivāka, vāhyaliṅgaiḥvaya:liṅge, makanimittamakadimitta *paṅanumānapaṅanumaṇapaṅanumaha katon, śabdanya kasalahan, kavnəsan, heṅashaṅa:s tan asiga rira vkasan, mulatmalat· muliṅā, sahulahsahalah alaṅə̄aṅə:.

lg.l: ākārair iṅgitair gatyā ceṣṭayā bhāṣitena ca |
netravaktravikāraiś ca gr̥hyate ’ntargataṁ manaḥ ||

div.p: takvanikaṅ manah, halit pinakabuṅkahiṅ buddhi, yadyapiyapi hinə-həttakənyaA perhaps quite plausible emendation, involving a slight departure from the transmitted reading, would be hinət-əttakənya. Either way, the meaning is the same. Note that we retain the gemination of t to tt before suffix -akǝn. hinət-ətakənyahinəhəttakənya denikaṅ avyavahāra, yan adharma, kavruhana hikā de saṅ prāgvivāka, makanimittamukanimitta vāhyaliṅgavayaliṅga:. ākāraiḥAkareḥ, iṅgitaiḥIṅgitaḥ, lakunya, ulahnya, śabdanya, vikāraniṅ hulatnya, vnəsniṅ mukanya.

div.head: Protection of Faithful Women
div.div:
bāladāyādikaṁ rikthaṁ tāvad rājānupālayet |
yāvat sa syāt samāvr̥tto yāvad vātītaśaiśavaḥ ||
Our mss. suggest a variant reading yāvat na syāt, i.e., yāvan na syāt, in pāda c.
kunaṅ dr̥vya kaliliraniṅni rare *tuvu-tuvuhtuvuhuvuḥ, kǝmitən kəkəsana saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ dr̥vya, yan apa maṅkana, yāvan nayavat na:rdg wit="#K">yavat na syāt samāvr̥ttosyat· samavr̥tosyat·, samavr̥to, yan tan uvusyan uvusyanvusWe supply tan, as the sentence would not be meaningful with huvus unnegated, and the negation is also implied by na in the Sanskrit lemma that precedes. maṅaji, yayanIs the K reading reading grammatically acceptable? Or should we suppress the word altogether? tapvan vnaṅ rumakṣa dr̥vyanya, kunaṅ yan uvus mulih sakiṅ gurunya, vnaṅ rumakṣa dr̥vyanya, vehakna ikaṅ dr̥vya iriya.

lg.l: vaśāputrāsu caivaṁ syād rakṣaṇaṁ niṣkulāsu ca |
pativratāsu ca strīṣu vidhavāsv āturāsu ca ||

div.p: strī valva-valvan mānak raray rakṣanǝnrakṣananrakṣanan ikā de saṅ prabhu, strī valuvalvavalva: tan pabapebupabavebu, strī valu vyādhi, makataṅgvanmakapaṅgvan satyanya riṅ jalunya, ika ta katiga rakṣanən de saṅ prabhu, sira haṅilaṅakna yan ana vvaṅ avamānaavvaṁṅamana hiriya, mataṅhyan maṅkana, ika kasatyan haneriya, pāvak bhaṭāra dharma katvaṅananirakatatvaṅarananira, kunaṅ yan satya ikaṅ strī, hayvatayva saṅ prabhu parabyāpāra irikā kabeh.

lg.l: jīvantīnāṁ tu tāsāṁ ye tad dhareyuḥ svabāndhavāḥ |
tāñ chiṣyāc cauradaṇḍena dhārmikaḥ pr̥thivīpatiḥ ||

div.p: yapvan ana kadaṅnikaṅkaṇḍaṁnikaṁ strī valu satya sḍaṅnyan ahurip, umalapa dr̥vyanya, ḍaṇdan ikaṅḍaṇda Ikaṁṅḍaṇḍa hikaṁṅReconsider this emendation: it seems ḍaṇḍa in this text might actually be capable of meaning daṇḍan. aṅalapalap de saṅ prabhu, sadaṇḍaniṅ maliṅ ḍaṇḍanyaḍaṇḍahanyaDo parallel passages in the text help to decide whether we expect irrealis here, or not?.

lg.l: pranaṣṭasvāmikaṁ rikthaṁ rājā tryabdaṁ nidhāpayet |
arvāk tryabdād dharet svāmī pareṇa nr̥patir haret ||

div.p: kunaṅ hikaṅ dr̥vya tan ana saṅ madr̥vya, kəkəsana de saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ dr̥vya maṅkana, tluṅ tahun lavasanyalavasnya, yapvan tkatkiṁ tikaṅ madr̥vya, haminta i sira vehakna hikaṅ dr̥vya de saṅ prabhu, yapvan alivat sakeṅsakiṁ tigaṅ tahun, alapən tikaṅtika dr̥vya de saṅ prabhu.

lg.l: mamedam iti yo brūyāt so ’nuyojyo yathāvidhi |
saṁvādya rūpasaṁkhyādīn svāmī tad dravyam arhati ||

div.p: dr̥vyaṅku iki liṅnya, saṅliṁnyansaṁ maṅaku dr̥vyamaṅakuvadr̥vya, ikaṅIka:kaṁ maṅkana, takvanana ya irikaṅ dr̥vya hinakunya, vruh pva ye rūpanya siṅgih ika dr̥vyanya, vehakna hiriya.

lg.l: avedayan pranaṣṭasya deśaṁ kālaṁ ca tattvataḥ |
varṇaṁ rūpaṁ pramāṇaṁ ca tatsamaṁ daṇḍam arhati ||

div.p: hana tan avruh ri kahilaṅaniṅrikaṁ hilaṅaniṁ dr̥vyanya, kālanya, nimittanya hilaṅ, varṇanya, rūpanya, kvehnya, kapva hikā tan ana kinavruhanyakavruhanya, kevalyasaṁ maṅaku dr̥vya, juga ya,maṅaku dr̥vya, Ikamaṅkana:, juga: ya:,The cancelled string was initially written due to eye-skip from the preceding paragraph. ikā ta vvaṅ maṅkana, yogya ḍaṇḍan ikāḍaṇḍa Ika:ḍaṇḍa hika:The same hesitation applies to our emendation here as in our note to the same emendation made in paragraph 30., samūlyanikaṅ dr̥vya hinakunya ḍaṇḍahanya.

lg.l: ādadītātha ṣaḍbhāgaṁ pranaṣṭādhigatān nr̥paḥ |
daśamaṁ dvādaśaṁ vāpi satāṁ dharmam anusmaran ||

div.p: kunaṅ yan təpət paṅakunya, vruh pve rūpanya, ikahikaṁ dr̥vya inakunya, vehakna ika dr̥vya hiriya, *aṅśanana *sapanəmaniṅ dr̥vyanya de saṅ prabhu, *sapapuluhanya kunaṅ, *paṅaṅśanira, rumakṣa dharmaniraḍarmma sira: saṅ prabhu yan maṅkana.

lg.l: pranaṣṭādhigataṁ dravyaṁ tiṣṭhed yuktair adhiṣṭhitam |
yāṁs tatra caurān gr̥hṇīyāt tān rājebhena ghātayet ||

div.p: kunaṅ ikaṅ dr̥vya, kinonakən saṅ prabhu kəkəsana deniṅ vadvā parcayanira, halapənyahapapənya taya, mapa ḍaṇḍanikācaṇḍanika: de saṅ prabhu, yan maṅkana, sikəpən sabhāknasabha:kuknasabhakakna, corah ṅaranya, hambahakna riṅ liman ḍaṇḍahanya.

lg.l: mamāyam iti yo brūyān nidhiṁ satyena mānavaḥ |
tasyādadīta ṣaḍbhāgaṁ rājā dvādaśam eva vā ||

div.p:
kunaṅ ikaṅ dr̥vya halavas pinəṇḍəm, dr̥vyaṅku iki liṅnya, pan tuhu dr̥vyanya, tantatan kinǝmit saṅ prabhu ikā, yadyapin maṅkana,
maṅkana de saṅ prabhu, sapanǝmanikaṅsapanmunikaṁ dr̥vya, sapararva-vlasanya, kunəṅ halapən anya.

lg.l: anr̥taṁ tu vadan daṇḍyaḥ svavittasyāṁśam aṣṭamam |
tasyaiva vā nidhānasya saṁkhyayālpīyasīṁ kalām ||

div.p: kunaṅ yan mithyamiṭyavivya ya, ḍaṇḍan, i savilaṅnikaṅ dr̥vya, lǝvihana ta sapavvalunyasapavalunya, lǝvihaEmend lǝvihana? sapanəmbəlasnyasapanəmbalanya kunaṅ.

lg.l: vidvāṁs tu brāhmaṇo dr̥ṣṭvā pūrvopanihitaṁ nidhim |
aśeṣato ’py ādadīta sarvasyādhipatir hi saḥ ||

div.p: kunaṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa, yan panəmvaṅ dr̥vya pinəṇḍəmpinənəmpinənḍəmm alavas, alapənira kabeḥ, tan aṅśananaaṅśana: de saṅ prabhu, mataṅnyan maṅkana, saṅ brāhmaṇa viśeṣanviśeṣa:n· riṅ janmajadma kabeh.

lg.l: yaṁ tu paśyen nidhiṁ rājā purāṇaṁ nihitaṁ kṣitau |
tasmād dvijebhyo dattvārdham ardhaṁ kośe praveśayet ||

div.p: saṅ prabhu kunaṅ yan panəmva dr̥vya pinəṇḍəm alavas, haveha sira satṅahnikaṅ dr̥vya tinǝmu denira i saṅ brāhmaṇa, ikaṅ satṅah alapənira.

lg.l: nidhīnāṁ hi purāṇānāṁ dhātūnām eva ca kṣitau |
ardhabhāg rakṣaṇād rājā bhūmer adhipatir hi saḥ ||

div.p: kunaṅ mataṅyanmataṅhyan inalapnira sapanmunikaṅ vvaṅ manmu parvaparuha:, kinarvanira lavan saṅ brāhmaṇa, phalanira parakṣaṅ rāt, apan svāminiṅ pr̥thivī tattvanira.

lg.l: dātavyaṁ sarvavarṇebhyo rājñā caurair hr̥taṁ dhanam |
rājā tad upayuñjānaś caurasyāpnoti kilbiṣam ||

div.p: kunaṅ ikaṅ dr̥vya kālap deniṅ maliṅ, vehakna hirikaṅ madr̥vya, i salviranikaṅ madr̥vya, yanyen kapaṅguhakapaṅgya:kapaṅgva: de saṅ prabhu ikaṅ dr̥vya, kunaṅ yan hinalap de saṅ prabhu ikaṅ dr̥vya, sapāpaniṅ maliṅ kapaṅguh denira.

lg.l: jātijānapadān dharmān śreṇīdharmāṁś ca dharmavit |
samīkṣya kuladharmāṁś ca svadharmaṁ pratipādayet ||

div.p: ulah kinapagəhakniṅnapagəhakniṅ janmajadma, mvaṅ kinapagəhakniṅkapagəhakniṅ tanitaniṁ janapada, kinapagəhakniṅ baṇyagabha:nyagana:nyaga: kunəṅ, kinapagəhakniṅ kavatəkanya, kunaṅ ika ta kabeh kapagəhakna de saṅ prabhu, yanyaOr would yar i be syntactially permissible here, and allow the same translation? ri svadharmanya, rumakṣa ri svadharmanira yan maṅkana.

lg.l: svāni karmāṇi kurvāṇā dūre santo ’pi mānavāḥ |
priyā bhavanti lokasya sve sve karmaṇy avasthitāḥ ||

div.p: yadyapi hadoh puṇḍuhnyapuṇḍaḥnya ikaṅ vvaṅ sādhu, ginavayakənyagavayakənya juga svakarmanya, yatna juga ri kajanmanyakajadmanya, kapva ta ya, hapagəh ririṁ svadharmanya sovaṅ-sovaṅ, rakṣan ikā de saṅ prabhu, tan hana varṇasaṅkaranikaṅvarṇnasaṅharanikaṁ rāt.

lg.l: notpādayet svayaṁ kāryaṁ rājā nāpy asya pūruṣaḥ |
na ca prāpitam anyena grasetārthaṁ kathaṁ cana ||

div.p: ayva saṅ prabhu prihavak yan pamgatakna vyavahāra, pvāgvivākanira maṅkanātah, tan prihavaka, tan paṅapa maṅajipaṅamapaṅa:jipaṅapavvaṁṅaji yan tan paviveka, saṅka pisana tuvi.

lg.l: yathā nayaty asr̥kpātair mr̥gasya mr̥gayuḥ padam |
nayet tathānumānena dharmasya nr̥patiḥ padam ||

div.p: kadyaṅganikaṅ tuhatva buru, tumut ikaṅ buron kna panah denya, titisniṅ rahnya paṅavruhanya riṅ paranya, maṅkanāta saṅ prabhu, kumavruhana ta dvā-tuhunikaṅprabhu kumavruhaniratadva:tuhunikaṁprabhu, kumavruhanira:tanḍya:tuhunikaṁOur emendation involves replacement of the syllables nira with na. Much depends here on whether or not to punctuate the text after prabhu, and whether to read maṅkana ta or maṅkanāta in the preceding clause. An alternative would be not to punctuate, to read maṅkana ta, and to emend kumavruhana ri kadvā-tuhunikaṅ. vyavahāra kālih, makanimitta *paṅanumāna vāhyaliṅgādivvahyaliṅga:ḍḍi.

lg.l: satyam arthaṁ ca saṁpaśyed ātmānam atha sākṣiṇaḥ |
deśaṁ kālaṁ ca rūpaṁ ca vyavahāravidhau sthitaḥ ||

div.p: kavruhananikakavruhanika saṅ prāgvivāka tuhuniṅ vyavahāra, sākṣinya, deśanya, kālanya, rūpanya, kapva kavruhananirakavruhana: sira, mapagəhamakapagəha ta sira, ri kavidhyaniṅ vyavahāra.

lg.l: sadbhir ācaritaṁ yat syād dhārmikaiś ca dvijātibhiḥ |
tad deśakulajātīnām aviruddhaṁ prakalpayet ||

div.p: ikaṅ maryāda huvusvuḥvus ginavayakǝnginavayakna saṅ paṇḍita, dhārmikaḍarmmikaṁdharmikaṁ brāhmaṇa, gavayakna tan paviruddha ya lavan deśa-kula-jāti-varga de saṅ prāgvivāka.

lg.l: adhamarṇārthasiddhyartham uttamarṇena coditaḥ |
dāpayed dhanikasyārtham adhamarṇād vibhāvitam ||

div.p: kunaṅ ikaṅ vvaṅ mahutaṅ, tagihən kǝdvaknakḍva:kna denikaṅ mapihutaṅ, śuddhānya hutaṅnya ri saṅ pradhanapra:ḍa:napr̥daṇaOJED records only pr̥dana (one occurrence each in Koravāśrama and Kuṭāra-Mānava), but the source of this words is evidently Sanskrit pradhana, and sources not used by Zoetmulder support our choice to rely here on the spelling found in L., prakāśaknanya tuvi, *uvusaniṅhusaniṁ hutaṅnya.

lg.l: yair yair upāyair arthaṁ svaṁ prāpnuyād uttamarṇikaḥ |
tair tair upāyaiḥ saṁgr̥hya dāpayed adhamarṇikam ||

div.p: kunaṅ hikaṅ mapihutaṅ, upāyanya kapva kāraṇaniṅ pihutaṅnyan mijilapahutaṁnya: mijila:, tan vehǝnveha maṅgəh atuṅgu, kāraṇanyan panahuranaṅpanahuraniṁpanaturraniṁOur emendation is supported by Kuṭāra-Mānava §7 kaṅ amateni amanahurana hutaṅe kaṅ den-pateni ikā and §77 anake amanahurana hutaṅe kaṅ apǝpǝgatan ikā. hutaṅnya.

lg.l: dharmeṇa vyavahāreṇa chalenācaritena ca |
prayuktaṁ sādhayed arthaṁ pañcamena balena ca ||

div.p: tagihən, asih-asihəna:sira:sihasihən·, konən manahura, kapiṅro, taṅtaṅən mavyavahārataṁtaṅənamavya:va:harataṁtaṅəna:mavyavahara, kapiṅtiga, hadānā sisilihan, kapiṅpat, dānana tuṅgal,dinana, tuṅgul·,dinana, maṅkana upāyaniṁ sumādhya pihutaṅnyapahutaṁnya mijila, tan kavnaṅ pva ya ikaṅ mahutaṅ deniṅ upāya pat, lakvakna ta kapiṅlimaniṅ upāya, valātkāran, irǝn huluna.

When the king is going to try a case, he should enter the court modestly accompanied by Brahmins and counselors who are experts in policy Now should his Majesty undertake to attend to litigation/affairs of this world, let him take as companions Brahmins who are knowledgeable and study Scripture, and likewise ministers with the wisdom to judge with discernment; with good conduct, he should enter the council.
